summary: on change and growing up (aka I wanted to write pregnant Bex and tyrus on a motorcycle (shoutout to that anon on captainkippen’s...
body:
on change and growing up

(aka I wanted to write pregnant Bex and tyrus on a motorcycle (shoutout to that anon on captainkippen’s inbox) so i found the way to put everything together, but it ended being really cheesy.)

Bex can hear the music booming from Andi’s room –the bass reverberating, the sweet melody, and the voice of whatever singer they are obsessed with currently muffled by the walls– and she can’t help but smile. She wouldn’t want to be sixteen again –God, no way–, but she is feeling nostalgic that afternoon.

There is something beautiful in the way teenagers feel, how intense their emotions are. When something is good, is the best, and when something bad happens, a tragedy.

She has to admit she is feeling a little bit like that, lately. She blames her out-of-control hormones due to pregnancy.

A growing noise on the street distracts her from her thinking. Andi told her that Cyrus is coming too, so when she hears the roar of a motorcycle in her driveway she steps to the window to see if it’s him.

Cyrus steps off the motorcycle, holding to TJ and legs a little shaky, and Bex can’t help a chuckle when Cyrus removes the helmet and his hair is a complete mess. TJ thinks the same, apparently, because even if Bex can barely see his face under his helmet, he ruffles Cyrus hair even more, eyes crinkling.

TJ, that’s another thing. From mortal enemy, to Cyrus’ boyfriend. Bex shakes her head, remembering Buffy complaining about the basketball team captain. And then Cyrus, not even a year later, practically waxing poetic about him.

Bex can see Cyrus’ smile from there, talking excitedly to TJ, who is still on the motorcycle. It doesn’t look like TJ is coming in –Cyrus is going to tell her why and how when he comes in, for sure–, but it’s a shame, because she actually likes the kid. He makes Cyrus happy.

She is lost in thought when she realizes that TJ is taking off his helmet and bringing Cyrus close to him. And, oh, they are kissing. Bex chuckles. Ah, to be young and in love.

She looks away when she realizes they are not going to stop kissing anytime soon. She should have realized sooner, of course they are not. They are sixteen and in love.

And they shouldn’t stop kissing, because that’s what they are supposed to do. Break curfew because they are so engrossed talking that they don’t realize how late it is, be late to everything because they can’t stop kissing while saying goodbye, arrive with ruffled hair and a swelled heart after spending time with each other.

She busies herself on the kitchen, waiting for the doorbell to ring. A few minutes later, she opens the door to a grinning, hair-ruffled Cyrus that greets her enthusiastically.

“Hey, what’s up, Cyrus?”

“Not much, I was with TJ” he says, his grin growing impossibly wider “But he has to go to work now”

“That’s a shame” Bex says, stepping aside to let him in. Her ever growing belly making it a little difficult. “The girls are in Andi’s room, come on, I’m going to ask them if they want something to eat”

On Andi’s room, Buffy is laying on the bed and Andi is on her desk making what seems to be a bracelet, talking over the music. They both look up and greet Cyrus with matching grins.

Bex sees them start talking excitedly –she doesn’t even know what they are talking about. A show? A singer? God, she is getting old–.

She stays there, leaning on the doorframe. It seems like a lifetime ago when she came back home and saw them, and at the same time it feels like it was only yesterday.

“Mom?” Andi says, waving a hand in her direction “What are you looking at?”

Bex shakes her head, trying to wake up from the daydream “God, you’ve really grown up, all of you”

Buffy snickers “What?”

“It’s just-“ Bex starts, but she’s not sure how to put it into words without sounding really cheesy “You are really different from how you were only three years ago”

“Well, I’m still awkward and clumsy” Cyrus says, shrugging “So things aren’t that different”

Andi and Buffy join him laughing, but Bex just raises an eyebrow in his direction.

“Cyrus, you just kissed goodbye your boyfriend in the driveway. Your boyfriend, who dropped you off on a motorcycle” Bex laughs when she sees that Cyrus starts blushing “You are comfortable enough with yourself to try new things. What would thirteen year old Cyrus say if he could see you?”

“Well, if you put it like that…” Cyrus stutters, trying to push away Andi and Buffy, who are making kissing faces and noises at him.

“And you Buffy,” Bex is having fun with that, so she is not going to stop there “You are the captain of the basketball girls’ team. And you lost the last match, but you didn’t care because you played well. You have learned to lose but also to win”

Buffy smiles, a smile that is half grin and half scoff, but Bex knows that she liked what Bex said.

“And Andi” Bex is actually fighting not to get teary-eyed with this. God, damn her hormones. “You have been through some shit, including the one I put you in, but you have grown up to be one of the kindest people I know. You are unapologetically yourself, and I’m extremely proud of you”

Silence falls, and Bex can feel the eyes of the three teenagers fixed on her.She clears her throat lightly.

“I’m proud of all of you, for finding who you are” Bex says, and inmediately after straightens herself “God, that was really cheesy”

“A little” Buffy says, frowning a little bit like she doesn’t understand what just happened.

Cyrus puts a hand on his chest, dramatically “I think it was beautiful”

Andi just looks at her, a little smile on her face. Bex doesn’t need her to talk, because she knows what she means with that look.

The same that Bex herself has been thinking during that cheesy speech.

That she loves her.

“Okay, enough” Bex says, shaking her head to try and stop her brain to go the nostalgic route again. She really needs to put herself together “Who wants pizza?”

summary:
Amber: Cyrus Goodman, would you do me the honour of becoming my brother-in-law?
Cyrus:
TJ:
TJ: Did you . . . Did you just...
body:
Amber: Cyrus Goodman, would you do me the honour of becoming my brother-in-law?

Cyrus:

TJ:

TJ: Did you … Did you just PROPOSE to Cyrus for me??

Amber: Well, SOMEBODY’S gotta do it TJ, and you happen to be taking forever!

summary:
Buffy: Okay, whole stole my baby taters? TJ?
TJ: I don't like baby taters.
Buffy: Andi?
Andi: I don't like food!
Buffy:...
body:
Buffy: Okay, whole stole my baby taters? TJ?
TJ: I don't like baby taters.
Buffy: Andi?
Andi: I don't like food!
Buffy: Jonah?
Jonah: ...it was Cyrus!
Cyrus: Yeah it was!

dialogue.phrase: Okay, whole stole my baby taters? TJ?
